alert.note: Alert for Lee; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 3:32PM EDT until July 14 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Georgia, including the following counties, Lee and Terrell. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leesburg, Dawson, Albany, Sasser, Bronwood, Bridges Crossroad, Jordan Place, Byne Crossroads, Armena, Neyami, Chickasawhatchee, Scrutchins, Dawson Municipal A/P, Century, Starksville, Palmyra, Forrester, Mossy Dell, Yeomans and Graves. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
